item.title: A-MOST 2021 Call for Papers
item.description: 17th Workshop on Advances in Model Based Testing (A-MOST 2021) April, 2021 A-MOST 2021 will be collocated with the IEEE International Conference on Software Testing, Verification and Validation (ICST 2021). Proceedings: Accepted papers will be published in the IEEE Digital Library. Paper format: IEEE two-column publication format. Full papers: 8 pages Short papers: 4 pages Journal first: 2 pages Important Dates Paper submission: Jan 10, 2021 Notification: Jan 31, 2021 Cameraâ€“ready version: Feb 20, 2021

item.title: A-MOST 2020 Program
item.description: A-MOST: Advances in Model-based Testing 24 October, 2020 A-MOST is a one-day workshop bringing together researchers and practitioners to discuss state of the art, practice and future prospects in Model Based Testing (MBT). It provides a platform to present new approaches, methods and tools to make MBT techniques (for automatic test case generation) more deployable and useful for industry than ever. Program A detailed program can be found here.

item.title: RoboSoft: software engineering for robotics
item.description: RoboSoft: Software Engineering for Robotics London, UK, 13-14 November, 2019 RoboSoft is a two-day event to bring together researchers representing groups working on themes relevant for Software Engineering for Robotics, developers working on the next-generation of robotic systems in various areas of application, and regulation authorities interested in safety of robotic systems. It provides a platform to establish Software Engineering for Robotics as an important discipline in Computer Science and Electronic Engineering.

item.title: SSBSE 2019 conference tracks and important dates
item.description: 11th Symposium on Search-Based Software Engineering Tallinn Estonia, 31 Aug - 2 Sep, 2019 SSBSE 2019 will be collocated with the 27th ACM Joint European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE 2019 conference). Conference proceedings: accepted papers will be published in a volume of the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science series (LNCS). Special issue for best papers: following the conference, the authors of the best manuscripts will be invited to extend their papers into full journal papers, for a Special Section of the Information and Software Technology Journal (IST).
